title: Establishes a veteran's outreach center distinctive license plate
summary: Establishes a veteran's outreach center distinctive license plate.
fulltext:
S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                         3192

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

                                   January 24, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by  M. of A. MORELLE, SCHROEDER -- read once and referred to
         the Committee on Transportation

       AN ACT to amend the vehicle and traffic law and the state  finance  law,
         in  relation  to  creating  the  veteran's outreach center distinctive
         license plate program and applying the revenues raised from  such  new
         program  to  the  purposes of supporting the veteran's outreach center
         fund

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section  1.  The  vehicle  and  traffic law is amended by adding a new
    2  section 404-x to read as follows:
    3    S 404-X. DISTINCTIVE VETERAN'S OUTREACH CENTER LICENSE PLATES.  1. ANY
    4  PERSON RESIDING IN THIS STATE SHALL, UPON REQUEST, BE ISSUED A  DISTINC-
    5  TIVE VETERAN'S OUTREACH CENTER LICENSE PLATE IN SUPPORT OF THE VETERAN'S
    6  OUTREACH CENTER, INC. IN ROCHESTER, NEW YORK BEARING THE PHRASE "SERVING
    7  THOSE WHO SERVE U.S.". APPLICATION FOR SAID LICENSE PLATE SHALL BE FILED
    8  WITH  THE COMMISSIONER IN SUCH FORM AND DETAIL AS THE COMMISSIONER SHALL
    9  PRESCRIBE. THE COMMISSIONER SHALL PROVIDE CONSPICUOUS NOTICE  TO  APPLI-
   10  CANTS,  IN  SUCH  FORM  AND  MANNER ACCEPTABLE TO THE COMMISSIONER, THAT
   11  SURCHARGES FROM THE ISSUANCE OF SUCH DISTINCTIVE  LICENSE  PLATE  SHALL,
   12  WHEN  AVAILABLE,  BE  USED FOR COMPREHENSIVE VETERANS' OUTREACH SERVICES
   13  PROVIDED BY THE VETERAN'S OUTREACH CENTER, INC. IN ROCHESTER, NEW YORK.
   14    2. A DISTINCTIVE PLATE ISSUED PURSUANT TO THIS SECTION SHALL BE ISSUED
   15  IN THE SAME MANNER AS OTHER NUMBER PLATES UPON THE PAYMENT OF THE  REGU-
   16  LAR  REGISTRATION  FEE  PRESCRIBED  BY  SECTION FOUR HUNDRED ONE OF THIS
   17  ARTICLE; PROVIDED, HOWEVER, THAT AN ADDITIONAL ANNUAL SERVICE CHARGE  OF
   18  TWENTY-FIVE  DOLLARS  SHALL  BE  CHARGED  FOR  SUCH  PLATES. SUCH ANNUAL
   19  SERVICE CHARGE SHALL BE DEPOSITED PURSUANT TO THE PROVISIONS OF  SECTION
   20  FOUR  HUNDRED FOUR-OO OF THIS ARTICLE TO THE CREDIT OF THE DEPARTMENT OF
   21  MOTOR VEHICLES DISTINCTIVE PLATE DEVELOPMENT FUND ESTABLISHED BY SECTION
   22  NINETY-FIVE-G OF THE STATE  FINANCE  LAW  AND  SHALL  BE  USED  FOR  THE
   23  PRODUCTION,  DESIGN,  ADVERTISING  AND  MARKETING OF DISTINCTIVE LICENSE
   24  PLATES PURSUANT TO SUCH SECTION NINETY-FIVE-G; PROVIDED,  HOWEVER,  THAT
   25  ANNUAL SERVICE CHARGES COLLECTED IN EXCESS OF SIX THOUSAND DOLLARS SHALL

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD06416-01-1

       A. 3192                             2

    1  BE  DEPOSITED  TO  THE  CREDIT  OF  THE "VETERAN'S OUTREACH CENTER FUND"
    2  ESTABLISHED PURSUANT TO SECTION NINETY-NINE-T OF THE STATE  FINANCE  LAW
    3  AND  SHALL  BE USED FOR GRANTS TO THE VETERAN'S OUTREACH CENTER, INC. IN
    4  ROCHESTER,  NEW  YORK  FOR  THE  PROVISION  OF  COMPREHENSIVE  VETERANS'
    5  OUTREACH SERVICES PURSUANT TO SECTION NINETY-NINE-T OF THE STATE FINANCE
    6  LAW; PROVIDED, FURTHER, THAT ONE YEAR AFTER THE EFFECTIVE DATE  OF  THIS
    7  SECTION,  FUNDS IN THE AMOUNT OF SEVEN THOUSAND FIVE HUNDRED DOLLARS, OR
    8  SO MUCH THEREOF AS MAY BE AVAILABLE, SHALL BE ALLOCATED FROM  SUCH  FUND
    9  TO THE DEPARTMENT TO OFFSET COSTS ASSOCIATED WITH THE PRODUCTION OF SUCH
   10  LICENSE PLATES.
   11    S  2. The state finance law is amended by adding a new section 99-t to
   12  read as follows:
   13    S 99-T. VETERAN'S OUTREACH CENTER FUND. 1. THERE IS HEREBY ESTABLISHED
   14  IN THE JOINT CUSTODY OF THE COMMISSIONER OF TAXATION AND FINANCE AND THE
   15  COMPTROLLER, A SPECIAL FUND TO BE KNOWN AS THE VETERAN'S OUTREACH CENTER
   16  FUND.
   17    2. SUCH FUND SHALL CONSIST OF ALL REVENUES RECEIVED  PURSUANT  TO  THE
   18  PROVISIONS  OF  SECTION  FOUR  HUNDRED FOUR-X OF THE VEHICLE AND TRAFFIC
   19  LAW, ALL REVENUES RECEIVED PURSUANT TO AN APPROPRIATION BY THE  LEGISLA-
   20  TURE, AND ALL OTHER MONEYS APPROPRIATED, CREDITED, OR TRANSFERRED THERE-
   21  TO  FROM  ANY  OTHER  FUND  OR SOURCE PURSUANT TO LAW. NOTHING CONTAINED
   22  HEREIN SHALL PREVENT THE STATE FROM RECEIVING GRANTS, GIFTS, OR BEQUESTS
   23  FOR THE PURPOSES OF THE FUND AS DEFINED IN THIS SECTION  AND  DEPOSITING
   24  THEM INTO THE FUND ACCORDING TO LAW.
   25    3.  MONIES OF THE FUND SHALL BE EXPENDED ONLY FOR GRANTS TO THE VETER-
   26  AN'S OUTREACH CENTER, INC. IN  ROCHESTER,  NEW  YORK,  A  NOT-FOR-PROFIT
   27  CORPORATION EXEMPT FROM TAXATION UNDER SECTION 501(C)(3) OF THE INTERNAL
   28  REVENUE  CODE  ESTABLISHED IN THIS STATE WITH A VOLUNTARY BOARD, FOR THE
   29  PURPOSE OF PROVIDING COMPREHENSIVE VETERANS' OUTREACH SERVICES. AS  USED
   30  IN  THIS SECTION, "COMPREHENSIVE VETERANS' OUTREACH SERVICES" SHALL MEAN
   31  SERVICES PROVIDED TO, OR PROJECTS FOR THE BENEFIT OF, VETERANS AND THEIR
   32  FAMILIES WHO ARE RESIDENTS OF THIS STATE, PERTAINING TO HEALTH,  MEDICAL
   33  AND  REHABILITATION SERVICES, EMPLOYMENT AND RE-EMPLOYMENT SERVICES, AND
   34  OTHER SERVICES ADDRESSING THE NEEDS  OF  VETERANS  AND  THEIR  FAMILIES,
   35  EXCLUSIVE OF ADMINISTRATIVE EXPENSES, INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO:
   36    A. CAREER COUNSELING;
   37    B. JOB DEVELOPMENT;
   38    C. MENTORING;
   39    D. BENEFITS ASSISTANCE;
   40    E. SUBSTANCE ABUSE AND MENTAL HEALTH COUNSELING;
   41    F. VETERAN ADVOCACY AND COMMUNITY EDUCATION;
   42    G. TRANSPORTATION;
   43    H. SOCIAL SERVICES;
   44    I. EMERGENCY, TRANSITIONAL, AND SUPPORTIVE HOUSING;
   45    J. MEDICAL FACILITY REFERRALS;
   46    K. CASE MANAGEMENT; AND
   47    L. CAPITAL PROJECTS IN SUPPORT OF SUCH PROGRAMS.
   48    4.  MONIES  SHALL  BE  PAYABLE FROM THE FUND TO THE VETERAN'S OUTREACH
   49  CENTER, INC. IN ROCHESTER, NEW YORK ON THE  AUDIT  AND  WARRANT  OF  THE
   50  COMPTROLLER ON VOUCHERS APPROVED BY THE COMPTROLLER.  NO MONEY FROM SUCH
   51  FUND  MAY BE WITHDRAWN, TRANSFERRED, OR USED BY ANY PERSON OR ENTITY FOR
   52  ANY PURPOSE OTHER THAN AS PERMITTED BY THIS SECTION.
   53    S 3. This act shall take effect on the one hundred eightieth day after
   54  it shall have become a law.
actClause: AN ACT to amend the vehicle and traffic law and the state finance law, in relation to creating the veteran's outreach center distinctive license plate program and applying the revenues raised from such new program to the purposes of supporting the veteran's outreach center fund
